15 December 1952
SCHEME OF PROPOSE)
>10 PROGRAM SERIES
(Related to Tocqueville*s trip. Series of programs begins
and ends in Paris. Tocqueville as narrator, at the same time
having full knowledge of intellectual philosophy of his completed
books. However, in dramatic episodes, Tocqueville is in process
of actively accumulating experience and insight. Each program
can have within it specific incidents and Americana of the time
which Tocqueville could have been a witness of or listener to a
report of, and which would adequately serve as a specific incident
to illustrate a Tocqueville generalization.)
PART I - (2 programs!
Behind the Journey of a Prophet
The Education of an Aristocrat
(French Revolution guillotined Tocqueville*s grandfather and
an aunt; parents had been imprisoned.)
The Decision to Visit America—and a Good Excuse
(Why they were interested in going to America.)
Preparations for Escape
(Uneasiness about current government and dislike of loyalty oaths.)
PART II - (3 programs - Robert Streeter)
Knickerbocker America
(General equality of condition; no soldiers in New York;
characteristics of first rough impressions of Americans:
Sensibility to human sufferings is sharpened;
Individual initiative;
Progress and perfectibility of man:
Ship building incident.)
Havre to New York—38 Days
Reception in New York
First Impressions of the Americans
Society and the City Authorities
Sing Sing—the Prison
Sing Sing—Reflections on American Society
(continued)
